source.body: Carefully perform in accordance with your institute's safety guidelines. If handling potentially infectious material, inspect for cracks or leaks during warming

source.description: Remove swab from Tube A using clean forceps, trim swab handle using scissors if necessary.
Place swab in Tube B (15 mL conical), dip briefly to rinse swab.
Move swab from Tube B (15 mL conical) to Tube C. Proceed directly to step 23 for Tube C.
Transfer liquid in Tube A to Tube B (15 mL conical).

Using
from Tube B (15 mL conical), wash Tube A.
Discard Tube A.

Transfer suspended cells from Tube B (15 mL) to Tube B (1.5 mL). Discard empty 15 mL conical.
Place Tube B (1.5 mL) on thermomixer (37ºC, 300 rpm).

Incubate for
.

.
Remove supernatant with P1000 pipette.

Place Tube B (1.5 mL) on thermomixer (37ºC, 300 rpm).

source.title: After Tube B, C, and D's 30 minute Incubations

source.description: After Tube B, Tube C, and Tube D have each finished their 30 minute incubations:

source.body: In practice, we wait until all tubes have finished their 30 minute incubation in Accutase to synchronize. We leave tubes on incubation for a maximum 50 minutes.

source.description: Transfer washing from 50 mL conical to Tube E.

In 96 well plate, add
.

Add
to well containing trypan blue.

Pipette to mix cells in trypan blue, transfer
to hemocytometer port.
Count viable cells across 4 quadrants.
Record total cell number and calculate cell concentration.
Take photo of cells at 20x.
Load 20,000 viable cells on Seq-Well array.

source.body: Or load total volume of Tube E if total cell count is lower than 20,000.

description: A protocol for recovering viable single cell suspensions from cryopreserved human nasopharyngeal swabs for downstream applications, such as single-cell RNA-seq. The illustrated schematic below details the process.
